title: Non-overlapping events
text: The Addition Principle of Counting states that if two events, A and B, are non-overlapping, the total number of ways either A or B can occur is simply the sum of the individual possibilities.

title: Addition Principle
text: The Addition Principle of Counting applies when the two events are non-overlapping, which means they cannot happen at the same time. Therefore, you don’t need to subtract any overlap, just add the individual possibilities.
